file_content.text: I'd forgotten... the smell of my own blood. I... I yield.
But Nalen, he... he's never been beaten. What... what are you going to do with him?
You... beat Nalen Raloch? Please--you're not going to kill him?
That decision isn't up to me. I should consult the Council first.
The Jedi Council must decide.
I won't kill him. He can go to the Jedi Temple until his fate is decided.
I'll take him prisoner.
But we still lose him. The village needs Nalen's help. How are we going to keep it together?
If you need me, I'll do whatever I can.
You can ask for my help.
Thank you. We'll remember.
Kalikori village is greater than one man. You will survive if you stand together.
[Force Persuade] Have hope.
Kalikori... it's an ideal, greater than one man. We'll survive if we work together.
Here. Nalen gave us these for the journey up here--take it. If we work together, that's all we need.
Relying on others to protect you makes you weak. Remember that.
Find your own strength.
We could always depend on him. Maybe... we pushed him into becoming this.
We'll carry Nalen to the temple, Master Jedi. We owe him that much.
We can carry Nalen to the temple, Master Jedi. He still belongs to us.
There's only one way this can end.
He has to die.
No, you can't do this! He defended our entire village, he's a hero!
No, please! He's Kalikori's hero, it can't end this way!
Put him on trial and everyone will know what he did. But if he dies, he will always be that hero.
Death will protect his legacy.
The secrets in his mind are too dangerous. I can't let him live.
Rajivari's knowledge must die.
He committed atrocities, risked people's lives. It ends now.
This is what he deserves.
Just do it right.
We should... take him home. The others will want to say goodbye.
I have been fool. Spoke false. You are no small hunter.
Perhaps not, but this is a beginning, not an end.
My training isn't over yet.
What do you mean?
I suppose one can't be right all the time.
Everyone makes mistakes.
Nalen Raloch. Saw true power here, after becoming dark thing. You had unfamiliar weapon, no preparation... winning could not be. But you stand.
Cannot be other. Scorekeeper has seen. Chosen for greatest honor.
You are Herald of Scorekeeper.
"Herald of the Scorekeeper"? What is that?
I'm the what?
Chosen one, Herald. Of great skill, power, honor. Scorekeeper sees, and favors.
Qyzen, I'm nobody special. I just did the best I could.
No, you must be mistaken.
Yes, is good for Herald to be humble. But Scorekeeper has shown favor. Is clear.
I don't believe in this "Scorekeeper"; how can I be her Herald?
But I'm not a Trandoshan.
Is no importance. You are Herald. Cannot be otherwise.
To lose points was horror. But Scorekeeper has led through darkness to greater thing. You.
I will follow, Herald. Wherever needed. Scorekeeper has shown path: to serve her Herald.
If you truly believe I am this "Herald," I'll do my best to live up to the name.
You do me honor, Qyzen.
You're welcome to accompany me, whatever your reasons.
Then, thank you.
Being the Herald of the Scorekeeper, having a powerful Trandoshan ally--who would argue?
I like the sound of this.
Is Scorekeeper I serve first. But you are Herald. I honor, and follow.
Is much news we have, Herald. Should return to Jedi Temple, speak to Council. And Yuon.
You as Herald, and victorious--shall please her. Come.
You make a lot of noise. I come for a Flesh Raider, I find a Jedi Padawan.
I come to listen. To think, among the dead. To fight for my people.
Why have you come?
The villagers said you'd taken this holoprojector, Nalen, and told me where to find you.
You must be Nalen Raloch.
I suppose they spun the tale of me being a "legendary protector," too. They don't understand.
My Master sent me, to bring Rajivari's holoprojector back to the temple.
To retrieve the holoprojector.
I don't explain my actions to strangers.
That's my business.
I'm called Nalen Raloch. The others in the village spin tales of their "legendary protector." They don't understand.
Are the Flesh Raiders destroyed? No. My people aren't safe until my learning's complete.
Tython's relics still have lessons. I listen. I can... do things I never imagined possible. I will be the defender my people deserve.
Perhaps your studies are making you into something else.
Something's wrong with you.
Jedi condemn what they can't control.
Once you become this great defender, what's the next step?
And what of the future?
We make Tython ours. No Jedi. No Republic. Our world to plow, and harvest, and defend.
We hunt the Flesh Raiders to extinction, and laugh. Rajivari showed me how to punish them.
Help Kalikori village if you wish, but Rajivari's holoprojector wasn't yours to take.
By stealing Jedi artifacts?
Tython is our home, too. We'll use whatever we find to defend ourselves; you Jedi don't have a say.
But you're not a concern. Only the Flesh Raiders matter. Rajivari's hologram showed me how to punish them.
The Flesh Raiders will come. But not leave. A merciful death, compared to what my people have suffered.
What crimes have I committed that deserve being buried alive?
Is this to punish me, too?
You'll get us both killed!
Stop this!
You're crazy.
There are hidden wonders, Jedi, and my journey has just begun.
Now run. Or die.
Fitting that it's you, armed with the last lightsaber this Forge will ever make.
Look at her! Another Jedi to nod, and preach, and do nothing while the Flesh Raiders ravage our home!
Look at him! Another Jedi to nod, and preach, and do nothing while the Flesh Raiders ravage our home!
I know Rajivari's secrets. Horrors that the Jedi--this Jedi!--have been chasing. And only I can protect us, our families and our future!
Nalen, your power is destroying you. But it isn't too late to save yourself.
I want to help you.
I'd like to hear what the others make of your opinions.
Let your friends speak.
Whatever future you'd create for Kalikori village would be tainted by what you've become.
You'd lead them into darkness.
Shut up! You attacked our friends, our brothers, in cold blood!
But maybe we don't have all the facts. What Nalen's been saying--something's not right.
Watch, then. Justice needs witnesses.
The only thing driving you is power and madness.
This isn't justice.
If you attack me, they'll see you injured, perhaps even killed.
I will defend myself.
Enough. First you, then your great Forge.
Nalen, she's done alright by us. You keep saying the Jedi are the enemy, but she's not.
Nalen, he's done alright by us. You keep saying the Jedi are the enemy, but he's not.
Nalen, this is... you're going too far. How is this protecting us?
I did this for all of you! If you can't see the danger, I'll show you myself!
Listen to your people. This is not what they want.
Stop lying to yourself.
It'll make sense when you're dead.
Nalen, I don't want to kill you.
Surrender. Please.
Then don't fight back.
Let's have this done.
Enough talk. [Attack]
So be it.
Does not fight alone. This is fight of honor--you owe blood, dark thing.
